channel.title: Plastic Podcast
channel.itunes:subtitle: Conversations about movies and interviews with filmmakers
channel.itunes:author: Robert Davis and J. Robert Parks
channel.itunes:summary: Hear in-depth discussions of movies, reports from film festivals, and interviews with filmmakers on the Plastic Podcast, hosted by Robert Davis and J. Robert Parks of DailyPlastic.com.
channel.description: Hear in-depth discussions of movies, reports from film festivals, and interviews with filmmakers on the Plastic Podcast, hosted by Robert Davis and J. Robert Parks of DailyPlastic.com.
channel.itunes:keywords: film reviews, interviews, movie reviews, paste magazine, errata, erratta, cinema

item.title: #35: The American, The Passenger, The Town, and The Void
item.itunes:author: Robert Davis and J. Robert Parks
item.itunes:subtitle: A conversation about four films
item.description: On this edition of the podcast Robert Davis and J. Robert Parks talk about the recent George Clooney film THE AMERICAN and use that as an excuse to talk about Michelangelo Antonioni's THE PASSENGER, Ben Affleck's THE TOWN, Gaspar Noe's ENTER THE VOID, about the need for a path, and about elemental films that convey their ideas with pictures and pacing rather than narratives.
item.itunes:summary: On this edition of the podcast Robert Davis and J. Robert Parks talk about the recent George Clooney film THE AMERICAN and use that as an excuse to talk about Michelangelo Antonioni's THE PASSENGER, Ben Affleck's THE TOWN, Gaspar Noe's ENTER THE VOID, about the need for a path, and about elemental films that convey their ideas with pictures and pacing rather than narratives.
item.itunes:keywords: film, George Clooney, Antonioni, Ben Affleck, Gaspar Noe

item.title: #34: AFI Fest: Certified Copy
item.itunes:author: Robert Davis and J. Robert Parks
item.itunes:subtitle: A conversation about the new film from Abbas Kiarostami starring Juliette Binoche
item.description: This edition of the podcast is a special joint production with the AFI Now web site, the online home of the AFI film festival in Los Angeles. Robert Davis and J. Robert Parks talk about the new film by Iranian master Abbas Kiarostami called CERTIFIED COPY starring Juliette Binoche. For more information about the fest, visit http://blog.afi.com/afifest
item.itunes:summary: This edition of the podcast is a special joint production with the AFI Now web site, the online home of the AFI film festival in Los Angeles. Robert Davis and J. Robert Parks talk about the new film by Iranian master Abbas Kiarostami called CERTIFIED COPY starring Juliette Binoche. For more information about the fest, visit http://blog.afi.com/afifest
item.itunes:keywords: film, Iranian film, Italy, Tuscany, AFI, AFI Fest, film festival

item.title: #30: Sherlock Holmes, Psycho
item.itunes:author: Robert Davis and J. Robert Parks
item.itunes:subtitle: A conversation that is, eventually, about how movies change.
item.description: Take the title of the podcast in either of two ways. In this edition of the Plastic Podcast, Robert Davis and J. Robert Parks talk about Guy Ritchie's recent adaptation of Sherlock Holmes and about Alfred Hitchcock's Psycho and Gus Van Sant's intriguing remake. It's our second podcast this month. Don't get used to it.
item.itunes:summary: Take the title of the podcast in either of two ways. In this edition of the Plastic Podcast, Robert Davis and J. Robert Parks talk about Guy Ritchie's recent adaptation of Sherlock Holmes and about Alfred Hitchcock's Psycho and Gus Van Sant's intriguing remake. It's our second podcast this month. Don't get used to it.

item.title: #29: Inception, Toy Story 3, Despicable Me
item.itunes:author: Robert Davis and J. Robert Parks
item.itunes:subtitle: A look back at a couple of the summer's big movies.
item.description: As we hit Labor Day and experience Chicago's first cool day in weeks, we look back at a couple of the summer's big movies, INCEPTION and TOY STORY 3, with a bonus nod to DESPICABLE ME. The beaches on Lake Michigan close this weekend, but we'll be back in two weeks. Yes, we will.
item.itunes:summary: As we hit Labor Day and experience Chicago's first cool day in weeks, we look back at a couple of the summer's big movies, INCEPTION and TOY STORY 3, with a bonus nod to DESPICABLE ME. The beaches on Lake Michigan close this weekend, but we'll be back in two weeks. Yes, we will.

item.itunes:author: Robert Davis and J. Robert Parks
item.itunes:subtitle: An interview with filmmaker Rian Johnson
item.description: On the triumphant return of the Plastic Podcast after a months-long hiatus, we talk with filmmaker Rian Johnson about THE BROTHERS BLOOM, starring Rachel Weisz, Adrien Brody, Mark Ruffalo, and Rinko Kikuchi.

item.title: #23: Toronto International Film Festival 2008
item.itunes:author: Robert Davis and J. Robert Parks
item.itunes:subtitle: A look at some of the films we saw in Toronto
item.description: On this episode we talk about our favorite (and other noteworthy) films from this year's Toronto International Film Festival, including RACHEL GETTING MARRIED, STILL WALKING, GOODBYE SOLO, 35 SHOTS OF RUM, THE WRESTLER, SUMMER HOURS, SLUMDOG MILLIONAIRE, and CHE plus experimental films by Nathaniel Dorsky and James Benning.
item.itunes:summary: On this episode we talk about our favorite (and other noteworthy) films from this year's Toronto International Film Festival, including RACHEL GETTING MARRIED, STILL WALKING, GOODBYE SOLO, 35 SHOTS OF RUM, THE WRESTLER, SUMMER HOURS, SLUMDOG MILLIONAIRE, and CHE plus experimental films by Nathaniel Dorsky and James Benning.
item.itunes:keywords: film, Toronto International Film Festival, TIFF

item.itunes:summary: Two interviews: Robert Davis talks with writer-director Azazel Jacobs about his new film, MOMMA'S MAN, and J. Robert Parks talks to actor and comedian Steve Coogan (HAMLET 2, TRISTRAM SHANDY, 24-HOUR PARTY PEOPLE)
item.itunes:keywords: film, momma's man, hamlet 2, tristram shandy

item.title: #21: Late Summer Speed Round
item.itunes:author: Robert Davis and J. Robert Parks
item.itunes:subtitle: Compact reactions to 14 late-summer movies: The Dark Knight, WALL*E, Man on Wire, Wanted
item.description: With the summer freshly in the can, we present 14 compact reactions (some more compact than others) to a season of mostly loud, mostly trashy movies. Picking up where our last speed round left off, we talk about THE DARK KNIGHT, WALL*E, MAN ON WIRE, WANTED, and others. Dump the lemonade, brew a pot of something warm, and bid adieu to the summer's second half.
item.itunes:summary: With the summer freshly in the can, we present 14 compact reactions (some more compact than others) to a season of mostly loud, mostly trashy movies. Picking up where our last speed round left off, we talk about THE DARK KNIGHT, WALL*E, MAN ON WIRE, WANTED, and others. Dump the lemonade, brew a pot of something warm, and bid adieu to the summer's second half.
item.itunes:keywords: film, batman, dark knight, walle, wall-e

item.title: #20: Baghead, Interview with the Duplass Brothers
item.itunes:author: Robert Davis and J. Robert Parks
item.itunes:subtitle: An interview with the writers and directors of Baghead
item.description: The Duplass brothers, Mark and Jay, may feign ignorance at times, but their new movie BAGHEAD is plenty smart. Mixing genres in clever ways, it even inspires chills through the hoariest of horror cliches, the cabin in the woods. We sat down with the brothers Duplass in an exceedingly warm Chicago conference room, and the conversation revolved around the process of writing and editing, why watching movies at night is a different experience, and the enduring classic that is FLETCH.
item.itunes:summary: The Duplass brothers, Mark and Jay, may feign ignorance at times, but their new movie BAGHEAD is plenty smart. Mixing genres in clever ways, it even inspires chills through the hoariest of horror cliches, the cabin in the woods. We sat down with the brothers Duplass in an exceedingly warm Chicago conference room, and the conversation revolved around the process of writing and editing, why watching movies at night is a different experience, and the enduring classic that is FLETCH.

item.itunes:author: Robert Davis and J. Robert Parks

item.itunes:summary: On this episode of the Errata Movie Podcast we talk about 18 summer movies, big and small, including THE HAPPENING, IRON MAN, INDIANA JONES, KUNG FU PANDA, and 14 others. Briefly!

item.title: Episode 017: Errol Morris and Standard Operating Procedure
item.itunes:author: Robert Davis and J. Robert Parks
item.itunes:subtitle: An interview with Errol Morris and a reconsideration of his latest film, Standard Operating Procedure
item.description: In this episode of the Errata Movie Podcast, J. Robert Parks talks with filmmaker Errol Morris about his new film, STANDARD OPERATING PROCEDURE, then we reconsider the film to see if our comments from Episode 16 hold up in light of the interview, a second viewing, and Morris's writings about the film.
item.itunes:summary: In this episode of the Errata Movie Podcast, J. Robert Parks talks with filmmaker Errol Morris about his new film, STANDARD OPERATING PROCEDURE, then we reconsider the film to see if our comments from Episode 16 hold up in light of the interview, a second viewing, and Morris's writings and public statements about the film.

item.title: Episode 016: The Visitor, Stop-Loss, Standard Operating Procedure
item.itunes:author: Robert Davis and J. Robert Parks
item.itunes:subtitle: A discussion of three new films plus an interview with the writer-director of The Visitor, Thomas McCarthy
item.description: In this episode of the Errata Movie Podcast, we talk about three movies that are currently playing in theaters around the country: THE VISITOR, STOP-LOSS, and Errol Morris's STANDARD OPERATING PROCEDURE, and we'll also hear a brief chat with the writer-director of THE VISITOR, Thomas McCarthy.
item.itunes:summary: In this episode of the Errata Movie Podcast, we talk about three movies that are currently playing in theaters around the country: THE VISITOR, STOP-LOSS, and Errol Morris's STANDARD OPERATING PROCEDURE, and we'll also hear a brief chat with the writer-director of THE VISITOR, Thomas McCarthy.

item.title: Episode 015: The Films of Michael Haneke
item.itunes:author: Robert Davis and J. Robert Parks
item.itunes:subtitle: A discussion of the films of Michael Haneke
item.description: In this episode of the Errata Movie Podcast, we talk about the films of Michael Haneke, including his new film, FUNNY GAMES (2007), starring Naomi Watts, Tim Roth, Michael Pitt, and Brady Corbet, plus earlier films CACHE (2005), TIME OF THE WOLF (2003), THE PIANO TEACHER (2001), CODE UNKNOWN (2000), FUNNY GAMES (1997), 71 FRAGMENTS OF A CHRONOLOGY OF CHANCE (1994), BENNY'S VIDEO (1992), and THE SEVENTH CONTINENT (1989).
item.itunes:summary: In this episode of the Errata Movie Podcast, we talk about the films of Michael Haneke, including his new film, FUNNY GAMES (2007), starring Naomi Watts, Tim Roth, Michael Pitt, and Brady Corbet, plus earlier films CACHE (2005), TIME OF THE WOLF (2003), THE PIANO TEACHER (2001), CODE UNKNOWN (2000), FUNNY GAMES (1997), 71 FRAGMENTS OF A CHRONOLOGY OF CHANCE (1994), BENNY'S VIDEO (1992), and THE SEVENTH CONTINENT (1989).

item.title: Episode 014: David Gordon Green on Snow Angels
item.itunes:author: Robert Davis and J. Robert Parks
item.itunes:subtitle: An interview with David Gordon Green, the director of Snow Angels
item.description: On this episode of the Errata Movie Podcast, we talk with filmmaker David Gordon Green (GEORGE WASHINGTON, UNDERTOW) about his new film, SNOW ANGELS starring an ensemble cast led by Kate Beckinsale and Sam Rockwell. Snow Angels is the first of three surprises that Green has in store for us this year.
item.itunes:summary: In this episode of the Errata Movie Podcast, we talk with filmmaker David Gordon Green (GEORGE WASHINGTON, UNDERTOW) about his new film, SNOW ANGELS starring an ensemble cast led by Kate Beckinsale and Sam Rockwell. Snow Angels is the first of three surprises that Green has in store for us this year.

item.title: Episode 013: 2007 Year in Review
item.itunes:author: Robert Davis and J. Robert Parks
item.itunes:subtitle: A look at our favorite films of 2007, both new and old, released and unreleased
item.description: In this March 1, 2008, episode of the Errata Movie Podcast, we try to shake off the headache caused by last night's New Year's festivities in order to present our favorite films of 2007.
item.itunes:summary: In this March 1, 2008, episode of the Errata Movie Podcast, we try to shake off the headache caused by last night's New Year's festivities in order to present our favorite films of 2007.

item.title: Episode 012: Marjane Satrapi and Mike White
item.itunes:author: Robert Davis and J. Robert Parks
item.itunes:subtitle: Interviews with the writer-director of the Oscar-nominated film Persepolis, Marjane Satrapi, and writer-director of Year of the Dog, Mike White.
item.description: In this episode of the Errata Movie Podcast, we talk with two filmmakers who've made serious movies that fall into categories normally reserved for un-serious movies: Marjane Satrapi of the Academy Award-nominated PERSEPOLIS and Mike White of YEAR OF THE DOG. Both of them have spent most of their careers as writers, but now they've directed their first films.
item.itunes:summary: In this episode of the Errata Movie Podcast, we talk with two filmmakers who've made serious movies that fall into categories normally reserved for un-serious movies: Marjane Satrapi of the Academy Award-nominated PERSEPOLIS and Mike White of YEAR OF THE DOG. Both of them have spent most of their careers as writers, but now they've directed their first films.
item.itunes:keywords: interviews, screenwriters, graphic novel, iran, comedy, animation, film, dvd

item.itunes:summary: In this episode of the Errata Movie Podcast, we talk about twelve new movies in theaters now or on DVD, including THE SAVAGES, I'M NOT THERE, MY KID COULD PAINT THAT, and a speed round featuring JUNO, THERE WILL BE BLOOD, THE RED BALLOON, and others.

item.itunes:summary: In this episode of the Errata Movie Podcast, we have a report from the Sundance Film Festival, with discussion of new films by that will be coming to theaters later this year, plus a conversation with blogger and film writer Brian Darr about the festival's experimental films.

item.title: Episode 003: Werner Herzog
item.itunes:author: Robert Davis
item.itunes:subtitle: An interview with Werner Herzog about Rescue Dawn, Grizzly Man, and other films
item.description: Today Rob talks with legendary filmmaker Werner Herzog about his new film, Rescue Dawn, starring Christian Bale, Steve Zahn, and Jeremy Davies. They also talk about films like Grizzly Man, The White Diamond, The Wild Blue Yonder, and, the documentary on which Rescue Dawn is based, Little Dieter Needs to Fly.
item.itunes:summary: Today Rob talks with legendary filmmaker Werner Herzog about his new film, Rescue Dawn, starring Christian Bale, Steve Zahn, and Jeremy Davies. They also talk about films like Grizzly Man, The White Diamond, The Wild Blue Yonder, and, the documentary on which Rescue Dawn is based, Little Dieter Needs to Fly.

item.title: Episode 001: Guy Maddin
item.itunes:author: Robert Davis
item.itunes:subtitle: An interview with Guy Maddin about Brand Upon the Brain!
item.description: For the inaugural Errata podcast, Rob talks with filmmaker Guy Maddin about his new silent film, Brand Upon the Brain!, which is being presented in various cities this summer as a live extravaganza, with an orchestra, foley artists, a soloing castrato, and a different celebrity interlocutor at each stop.
item.itunes:summary: For the inaugural Errata podcast, Rob talks with filmmaker Guy Maddin about his new silent film, Brand Upon the Brain!, which is being presented in various cities this summer as a live extravaganza, with an orchestra, foley artists, a soloing castrato, and a different celebrity interlocutor at each stop.
item.itunes:keywords: silent film, silent movie, interview, cinema, director, filmmaker
